summary_points: 1. On June 13, 2025, Arista Networks appointed Todd Nightingale as President and Chief Operating Officer, effective around July 1, 2025.
2.  Nightingale's compensation package includes a $350,000 annual base salary,  $30,000,000 in restricted stock units (RSUs), and $2,000,000 in performance-based stock units (PSUs).

3.  Arista Networks will enter into a severance agreement with Nightingale; if his employment is terminated involuntarily without cause or he resigns for "good reason," he will receive 12 months of base salary and accelerated vesting of time-based equity awards.

1. At Monster Beverage Corp.'s June 12, 2025 annual meeting, the re-election of Mark S. Vidergauz to the board of directors received significantly fewer votes (733,750,723) compared to other directors, indicating potential concerns among shareholders.
2.  Ernst & Young LLP's appointment as the company's independent auditor for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2025, was ratified with 873,478,275 votes for and only 790,395 votes against.

3.  Shareholder approval of Monster Beverage Corp.'s named executive officers' compensation (June 12, 2025) was advisory and non-binding, receiving 796,662,922 votes for, 55,307,300 votes against, with abstentions and broker non-votes also recorded.
1. On June 13, 2025, Rob Berntsen resigned as Xcel Energy's Executive Vice President, Chief Legal and Compliance Officer to pursue another opportunity.
2. Ryan Long was promoted to replace Berntsen, effective June 16, 2025; he will also continue to oversee Northern States Power Company while a search for a new president is conducted.
3.  Xcel Energy will conduct an internal and external search for a new president of Northern States Power Company.

1. Warner Bros. Discovery successfully amended the indentures governing its outstanding notes, eliminating most restrictive covenants and certain events of default, with consent received ranging from 77.17% to 98.59% of the aggregate principal amount.
2.  As of June 16th, 2025,  tender offers to repurchase notes are still open and will expire on July 9th, 2025, unless extended.
3. After July 9th, 2025 (unless extended), Warner Bros. Discovery plans to acquire any remaining outstanding notes through open market purchases or further tender/exchange offers.
1. On June 13, 2025, Starbucks Corporation entered into a new $3 billion revolving credit facility with a maturity date of June 13, 2030, and the option to increase commitments by up to $1 billion.
2.  This new $3 billion credit agreement replaced a previous credit agreement dated September 16, 2021.

3. The new credit agreement includes covenants requiring Starbucks to maintain a minimum fixed charge coverage ratio of 2.50 to 1; failure to meet this covenant could result in lenders declaring outstanding amounts immediately due and payable.
1. On June 11, 2025, Seagate Technology Holdings plc redeemed all outstanding 4.875% Senior Notes due 2027 at a redemption price of 100.819% of the principal amount, plus accrued interest.
2.  As of June 10, 2025, between 61.49% and 95.39% of eight series of outstanding senior notes were tendered in exchange offers for new notes issued by Seagate Data Storage Technology Pte. Ltd.
3.  Seagate intends to issue the new notes under multiple indentures, eliminating substantially all restrictive covenants and certain default provisions from the existing indentures.
1. On June 11, 2025, Bunge Global SA amended its subsidiaries' revolving credit agreements, increasing available credit by $2.5 billion contingent on governmental approval of its Viterra acquisition.

2.  The amended credit agreements include provisions for cancellation of the incremental commitments under certain circumstances, such as non-completion of the Viterra acquisition by December 31, 2025.

3.  Bunge's subsidiaries will have access to an additional $1.75 billion in credit upon  governmental approval of the Viterra acquisition, increasing the total available credit under the European facility to $3.5 billion.

1. On June 16, 2025, Becton, Dickinson and Company (BD) announced a proposed settlement of stockholder derivative litigation, involving alleged misstatements regarding software defects in its Alaris infusion pump system, with a $9,000,000 payment to be made to BD from the defendants' D&O insurance, and the adoption of corporate governance modifications.
2.  The proposed settlement includes a $3,470,000 fee award to plaintiffs’ counsel, and potential service awards to plaintiffs not exceeding $5,000 each.
3. A hearing to determine the fairness of the settlement is scheduled for August 11, 2025.

1. Motorola Solutions, Inc. completed a public offering of $2 billion in senior notes on June 16, 2025, comprised of $600 million in 4.850% notes due 2030, $500 million in 5.200% notes due 2032, and $900 million in 5.550% notes due 2035.
2.  The notes offering is part of the financing for Motorola Solutions' acquisition of Silvus Technologies Holdings Inc., with the acquisition agreement dated May 27, 2025.

3. Failure to consummate the Silvus acquisition by May 22, 2026 (or a later agreed-upon date) will trigger a mandatory redemption of the 2030 and 2032 notes at 101% of principal plus accrued interest.
1. At the June 12, 2025 Annual Meeting, approximately 95.01% of Ingersoll Rand Inc.'s common stock entitled to vote was present.
2.  In the election of directors, Vicente Reynal received 353,442,051 votes "for," while 14,998,428 voted "against," and 13,026,235 were broker non-votes.
3. Shareholder proposals to ratify Deloitte & Touche LLP as the independent auditor and approve executive compensation (non-binding) both passed.
1. On June 12, 2025, Analog Devices Inc. issued $1.5 billion in senior notes, $850 million due June 15, 2028, and $650 million due June 15, 2030, at interest rates of 4.250% and 4.500% respectively.

2.  The company has the option to redeem the notes in whole or in part before their maturity date, at a price equal to the greater of the present value of remaining payments or 100% of the principal amount plus accrued interest.

3.  The notes are unsecured and rank equally with all other existing and future unsecured senior indebtedness of the company, potentially increasing the risk of default if the company's financial health deteriorates.

1. Corpay, Inc.'s annual meeting on June 11, 2025, saw shareholder votes on electing eleven directors, ratifying Ernst & Young LLP as the independent auditor, approving executive compensation, and a shareholder proposal regarding an independent board chair, with varied levels of support for each proposal.
2.  A significant portion of shareholders (approximately 50%) voted against the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks are explicitly mentioned in this section of the filing.
1. Monolithic Power Systems, Inc. (MPS) eliminated its classified Board of Directors structure, effective June 12, 2025, transitioning to annual elections of directors, fully completed by 2030.
2. At the 2025 annual meeting, shareholder votes to declassify the board were 42,120,982 for and 52,600 against, with 54,882 abstentions and 1,678,646 broker non-votes.
3.  A $1.56 per share cash dividend was declared on June 13, 2025, payable to stockholders of record on June 30, 2025, with payment occurring on July 15, 2025.

1. Laura Fennell, Intuit Inc.'s Executive Vice President and Chief People & Places Officer since August 2018, will transition to a new role on July 31, 2025, remaining employed until September 1, 2027, with a significantly reduced salary and bonus structure after July 31, 2026.
2.  Fennell's base salary will decrease from $770,000 to $200,000 annually between August 1, 2026 and September 1, 2027.
3. Caryl Hilliard, Intuit Inc.'s Senior Vice President, People & Places, will become the new Chief People & Places Officer effective August 1, 2025.
1. On June 16, 2025, Amphenol Corporation issued and sold €600,000,000 of 3.125% Senior Notes due 2032 and $750,000,000 of 4.375% Senior Notes due 2028 in separate offerings.
2. The net proceeds from the Euro-denominated notes, after underwriting discounts and expenses, were approximately €591.3 million.
3.  Amphenol intends to use the net proceeds from both offerings to repay borrowings under its U.S. commercial paper program and for general corporate purposes.

1. Nasdaq, Inc.'s 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders on June 11, 2025, resulted in the election of twelve director nominees, advisory approval of executive compensation, ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as the independent auditor, and approval of an amendment to the company's certificate of incorporation allowing for limited officer exculpation.

2.  Shareholder votes against the proposal to approve an amendment to the Company’s Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation to Allow for the Limited Exculpation of Officers of the Company totalled 37,846,944 shares, representing a significant portion of the vote.

3. While the filing doesn't explicitly state future impacts or risks, the substantial number of votes against the limited exculpation proposal (37,846,944) suggests potential future legal and reputational risks if this limited protection for officers is challenged.
1.  American Express reclassified approximately $1.6 billion in Card Member loans related to its Amazon small business cobrand portfolio to loans held for sale, effective June 1, 2025.
2.  The 30-day past due loan rate for U.S. Consumer Card Member loans decreased from 1.4% on April 30, 2025 to 1.3% on May 31, 2025.
3.  The net write-off rate for U.S. Small Business Card Member loans remained relatively stable at 2.4% in both April and May 2025.

1. T-Mobile US, Inc. and its subsidiary exchanged up to $2,044,000,000 aggregate principal amount of United States Cellular Corporation’s outstanding senior notes for a like principal amount of T-Mobile’s new senior notes, as of the early participation date of June 13, 2025.
2.  As of June 13, 2025, the percentage of tendered Old USCC Notes ranged from 74.20% to 89.56%, with the highest percentage for the 6.700% Senior Notes due 2033.
3. The acquisition of USCC assets is expected to close by mid-2025, contingent on regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.
